note.p: Phonetician and mathematician. Born Alexander John Sharpe; adopted his mother’s maiden name of Ellis in 1825. BA, Cambridge (Trinity College), 1837. Developed phonetic alphabets and notation to improve English spelling and pronunciation; produced a five-volume history of English pronunciation. Translated Hermann Helmoltz’s work on acoustics. Provisional committee member of the Association of Liberal Thinkers, 1878. FRS 1865.
Letter from M. D. Conway, 18 November 1878
